title: John Pekyns
text:
John Pekyns was an <a href="University%20of%20Oxford">Oxford</a> <a href="Colleges%20of%20the%20University%20of%20Oxford">college</a> <a href="Chief%20executive%20officer">head</a> in the <a href="16th-century">16th-century</a>.
Pekyns was educated at <a href="Exeter%20College%2C%20Oxford">Exeter College, Oxford</a>, graduating <a href="Bachelor%20of%20Arts">B.A.</a> in 1523 and <a href="Master%20of%20Arts%20%28Oxbridge%20and%20Dublin%29">M.A.</a> in 1524. He was <a href="List%20of%20Rectors%20of%20Exeter%20College%2C%20Oxford">Rector</a> from 1531 to 1534. A priest, he held the <a href="Living%20%28Christianity%29">living</a> at <a href="Bradwell%20juxta%20Mare">Bradwell juxta Mare</a> from 1542 until his deprivation in 1554. He was also a <a href="Canon%20%28priest%29">Canon</a> of <a href="Westminster%20Abbey">Westminster</a>.
